title: AdaSwap - The next-gen DEX!
description: Cardano is not known yet as a DeFi player, not enough celebrities, media and coverage care about Cardano at the moment.

f6_assessments.q0: Whilst a well working DEX on Cardano would effectively address this challenge, the proposers have not put any detail into the proposal. If you are asking for $150,000, you should write a summary of what are the benefits of you proposal vs other proposed DEX's rather than just a link to your website. Voters will not be able to access this easily through the voting app.
f6_assessments.q1: No plan has been presented. The statement "We have a ton of influence in Israel as well as strategic partnerships with influencers and business people that could take care of it." does not count as relevant experience. Please provide a plan of what you intend to do with timelines and mile stones and an explanation of what you would use $150,000 for. DO you need more than that to complete the project, if so, where do you expect to raise the additional funding.
f6_assessments.q2: Please proivde timelines and milestones against which progress can be audited and define some metrics and goals against which success can be measured.

f6_assessments.q0: A properly working DEX with additional features is for sure needed for Cardano. There are however a few existing players on this market, and as Ethereum sample shows - two or three players are enough in this space.
f6_assessments.q1: With all due respect but influencers contacts cannot guarantee a successful product. Maybe the token can become popular, give great returns but that's not the ultimate aim such proposal should have. I would suggest introducing some experienced developers in the team (at least a CTO who can gather a reliable team) before start - so that there is at least some technological background behind the idea. The proposal itself is very short and doesn't give much information. After going through the website I found the whitepaper really short and very general, not really touching essential points as development and technology.
f6_assessments.q2: No KPIs or possible to assess aims were present, therefore it is not enough to audit the progress or success of AdaSwap. Giving a roadmap and backing it up with reasonable team members (real names, please, these work better than nicknames) would allow for more trust to the proposer.

f6_assessments.q0:
The problem statement makes an association of lack of ackowledge about DeFi on Cardano with lack of coverage in social media and through celebrities, leaving out the quality of the projects, which I see as a big problem. The solution description is extremely vague and abstract.

I recommend that the team establish a clearer relationship between problem and solution and focus on project quality rather than promoting on social media.

A DEX based on the AMM model is a very promising concept and is within the scope of the challenge, as it is one of the most useful and necessary types of dapps for the DeFi ecosystem, but the absence of any plan, goals or metrics does not make it possible indicate a relevant impact on Cardano's DeFi challenge and ecosystem.

Due to the lack of concrete information to quantify the impact potential my score is 1.

I recommend that the team include a plan (as set out in the documentation for creating Catalyst proposals) and details that allow us to measure the impact of the proposal.

The attached file only describes information about tokenomics, token allocation, vesting and burning, so there is not enough information to evaluate the technical part of DEX.

I checked the Adaswap website, but the whitepaper presented there also has little technical information and plans to serve as a guide for this evaluation.

The video inserted as an attachment contains an unfounded argument:

"AdaSwap is the first AMM and decentralized exchange built on the Cardano network..."

There are more than ten DEX projects that have publicly announced the development of DEXs on Cardano. The Alonzo mainnet doesn't start until the 12th of September and the claim of being "the first" can be misleading.

"Adaswap is going to be that backbone of Cardano..."

There is not enough information to validate these claims.
f6_assessments.q1:
There are no details about the qualification of the team in the proposal. On the AdaSwap website I could find more information about 4 team members.

There are 3 members with public profiles on Linkedin, but the experiences described by the team are only in PR and management, there is no information about anyone who has expertise for the technical development of DEX.

I recommend that the team make it clear if there is anyone with experience/qualification for developing smart contracts and the technical part of the project itself.

There are no details about the qualification of the team in the proposal. On the AdaSwap website I could find more information about 4 team members.

There are 3 members with public profiles on Linkedin, but the experiences described by the team are only in PR and management, there is no information about anyone who has expertise for the technical development of DEX.

I recommend that the team make it clear if there is anyone with experience/qualification for developing smart contracts and the technical part of the project itself.

There is no plan, budget or any other information that would allow me to assess the feasibility of the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2:
In addition to a few details about the team (which are not in the proposal but I could check it on LinkedIn) there is no information that allows auditing the proposal.

I recommend that the team follow the Catalyst documentation for proposal creation and include the necessary auditability information described there.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed platform will definitely increase Cardanos Eco-system, as DeFi is still in its early steps in Cardano and the aims of this project seem reasonable for growing the DeFi industry of Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The experience given and whitepaper shown are not sufficient to allow me (and other community members) to believe in the success of this project. Also the requested funds are not justified what they are needed for.
f6_assessments.q2: There is unfortunately no information on how the next steps in this project are and how to allow a decent auditing process. However, a DeFi application will have some metrics just by it self to allow auditing of success (trading volume, number of pools / users, ... )

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal doesn't even build confidence that the team knows what DeFi or DEX is. There's no description. Lots of red flags.
f6_assessments.q2: Lack of description. Unreasonable amount of funds requested ($150k). No KPI and 3, 6, 12 month goals. Having red flags outside of Catalyst.

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano will need a de Fi app, althought there are projects which are already at an advanced stage, like sundaeswap, and ergodex
f6_assessments.q1: Having an influence in Israel is not a key factor to have this project succeeding
f6_assessments.q2: There is no budget breakdown, no key metrics and no roadmap either [3,6,12 months]

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is like many other swap projects on the platform that have been implemented, the actual need to expand on the cardano platform.
f6_assessments.q1: The project has a website, a full whitepaper / roadmap / Tokennomics document. In terms of technology, need more information, what special technology or research algorithms are used, which are more prominent than other projects or what are the risks?
f6_assessments.q2: Have a full roadmap with a step-by-step goal plan. Solution to support users to swap tokens on the cardano platform

f6_assessments.q0:
This is really laudable proposal with potential to bring increased adoption of the ecosystem through such innovative decentralised finance products.

I believe that there are other prospective and promising Dexs, this proposal if funded will be a most welcome addition in the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1:
Not much information on the team's qualifications and necessary hands on experience that gives much clarity that they can deliver this project. 

Notwithstanding that the fact that there might be plans to bring relevent technical partners and other collaborations, I thought that this sort of partnerships should be have been stated in the proposal. 

Such inclusion would have given the voters more confidence.

In addition, considering the amount of funds requested,it is only fair that the proposal should have details of the budget tailored to the plans and/or execution stages.
f6_assessments.q2:
Given the scope of this proposal,am surprised that there is no metrics or success measures.

There is no mention of anyway to guage the success of the proposal at each milestone of its rollout if funded.

solution: We plan to revolutionize the ecosystem of Cardano like PancakeSwap did for the Binance Smart Chain!
experience: We have a ton of influence in Israel as well as strategic partnerships with influencers and business people that could take care of it.
